item.title: sheetcheatR R Package
item.description:
The sheetcheatR package contains a series of learnr tutorials for new users to R (or the tidyverse).

Install this package from GitHub below:

install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("mjfrigaard/sheetcheatR")

Access the tutorial right in your RStudio session by using the following:

library(sheetcheatR)
library(learnr)
learnr::run_tutorial("import", package = "sheetcheatR")

So far the topics include:

  1. Command-Line Introduction: tools for navigating and managing files (cd, pwd, touch, echo, etc.), pipes, and downloading data

  2. Atomic Vectors: An introduction to R’s foundational data object

  3. S3 Vectors: Factors, dates, datetimes, and difftimes

  4. Rectangular data in R: Matrices, data.frames, tibbles, and data.tables

  5. Data import with readr, readxl, and googlesheets4

  6. Data visualization with ggplot2 cheatsheet (part 1)

  7. Tidying your data with tidyr (part 1)

  8. Data Transformation with dplyr (part 1)

This package is still in development–see the posts for more information as I complete additional tutorials.

Cheers!

item.title: `goodenuffR` R Package
item.description:
The goodenuffR package is based on the excellent advice in the paper, Good Enough Practices for Scientific Computing by Wilson et al.

The goal of goodenuffR is to setup your project files and folders in a structure similar to the one outlined in the paper above (and like the folder tree below):

|-- CITATION
|-- README
|-- LICENSE
|-- requirements.txt
|-- data
|   -- birds_count_table.csv
|-- doc
|   -- notebook.md
|   -- manuscript.md
|   -- changelog.txt
|-- results
|   -- summarized_results.csv
|-- src
|   -- sightings_analysis.py
|   -- runall.py

goodenuffR creates the format below using the following lines of code:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("mjfrigaard/goodenuffR")
library(goodenuffR)
goodenuffR::goodenuff_project(project_name = "my project", # name of project
                                folder_path = "~/projects") # path to project
goodenuff_files()

├── CITATION
├── LICENSE
├── README.Rmd
├── code
│   ├── 01-import.R
│   ├── 02-tidy.R
│   ├── 03-wrangle.R
│   ├── 04-visualize.R
│   ├── 05-model.R
│   ├── 06-communicate.R
│   └── runall.R
├── data
│   ├── README.md
│   └── raw
├── docs
│   ├── changelog.txt
│   ├── manuscript.Rmd
│   └── notebook.Rmd
├── my_project.Rproj
├── requirements.txt
└── results
    ├── figures
    ├── manuscript
    └── tables

Package website

Here is a link for the package website I built using the phenomenal pkgdown package. Feel free to check it out and leave comments!

Cheers!
